spans.text: Algae of Periphyton of Lake Teletskoye
Institute for Water and Environmental Problems, Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences,
—The generalized data are given on the composition and structure of phytoperiphyton of Lake
Teletskoye on different substrates (rocks, macrophytes and their residues). It is noted that in spite of the
differences in the taxonomic structure and level of development the algocenoses of periphyton of various
substrates have similar ecological range. This gives a possibility of using the algocenoses of periphyton on
different substrates for assessing the quality of the lake water.
Lake Teletskoye is located in the northeast part of
Altai Mountains at the level of 434 m a.s.l. Its surface
, the shore line is 192.8 km long, the
maximum width is 5.2 km, maximum depth—323 m
[1]. The area of littoral zone limited by the 10-m isobath
, or 3.4 % of the total surface area (in 1934 the
lake area was believed to be 228 km
areas bordering the water edge are influenced by two
and wave-cut process. The water level in the lake can
change for 0.1 m in 7–12 minutes and up to 6 m in a
year. The water level change is accompanied by a pow-
erful wave-cut process as a result of constant movement
of air masses in the lake valley. The winds are classified
as those of local and general atmospheric circulation. In
summer the winds of general circulation last from 1–
8 hours to 3–8 days. When the general atmospheric cir-
culation decreases, the local winds with expressed daily
course grow stronger. The waves can be as high as
The littoral is represented by the rock, boul-
der-stone, coarse materials in the open part and sand,
gravel, granite boulders in the talus trains of the major-
ity of the tributaries [3]. The vegetation is represented
mostly by phytoepilithon–the algae of periphyton de-
In the areas with lowered wind-wave load and sandy
and silted grounds (bays, mouth areas of some tributar-
ies, northwest area of relatively shallow stretch) the
higher water vegetation develops. The area under
macrophytes is about 30% of the total littoral area [4].
Phytoepiphyton, the another type of algocenoses of
periphyton develops on the surface of water plants.
Hydrothermal regime of the lake is characterized by
low temperatures. The water temperature exceeding
10°C is observed annually only in the upper 10 m for no
longer than 2.5 months [3]. At low water temperature
the macrophytes decay slowly. The plant residues stay
on the shallow bottom for a long time creating an
additional substrate for the development of periphyton
group of hydrocarbonate class) changed from 41.4 to
, pH—from 7.2 to 7.6. The content of or-
ganic matter in the lake water is insignificant, with per-
manganate oxidizability varying from 1.1 to 5.4 mgO/
should note the long-term stability of these elements of
The methods of using the phytoperiphiton in the
monitoring of ecological state of a water object are
based on the changes of the structure of algocenoses as
a result of the influence of the environmental factors,
including human impact [6]. The purpose of this work
is to compare the composition and structure of the
those on plant residues) and to determine the signifi-
cance of the changes of the water communities in Lake
Teletskoye for indicating the changes of the abiotic
From May to October, 1998, 2002, and 2003, we
studied the algocenoses of the rock littoral of the lake to
a depth of 1.5 m. The structure of phytoepilithon in
June–August, 1928–1931, to a depth of 30 m is charac-
terized by the data given in the works by N. N. Vo-
ronikhin [7], V. S. Poretskii and V. S. Sheshukova [8].
In June–August, 2004–2005, the algae vegetating on
the dynamics of composition and structure of the al-
gae on the plant residues was researched. The total of

different substrates for assessing the quality of the lake water.

monitoring of ecological state of a water object are
based on the changes of the structure of algocenoses as
a result of the influence of the environmental factors,
including human impact [6]. The purpose of this work
is to compare the composition and structure of the
those on plant residues) and to determine the signifi-
cance of the changes of the water communities in Lake
Teletskoye for indicating the changes of the abiotic
From May to October, 1998, 2002, and 2003, we
studied the algocenoses of the rock littoral of the lake to
a depth of 1.5 m. The structure of phytoepilithon in
June–August, 1928–1931, to a depth of 30 m is charac-
terized by the data given in the works by N. N. Vo-
ronikhin [7], V. S. Poretskii and V. S. Sheshukova [8].
In June–August, 2004–2005, the algae vegetating on
the dynamics of composition and structure of the al-
gae on the plant residues was researched. The total of

233 samples of phytoepilithon, 22 samples of phytoepi-
phyton, and 8 samples of algae from plant residues was
The samples of the algae from different substrates
were taken by standard methods [9]. Phytoepilithon
was washed off the rocks (0.15–0.2 m in diameter), the
algae cover on which was the most typical of the given
area of the lake. The algae were separated from the sub-
strate with a hard toothbrush and fixed in 40% formalin.
Phytoepiphyton was collected from the species of
higher water plants dominating in the studied area. The
plant was covered with a plastic bag and taken out of
water. The bag’s contents were transferred into a deep
dish, where the algae were washed off the macrophyte
with a wide brush, mixed, and a part of the suspension
was fixed in 40% formalin [4]. The area of wide leaves
of the macrophytes was determined by their contour on
paper, the area of horse-tail stems and leaves was
calculated like that of a cylinder.
The dynamics of the change in the structure of the
algocenoses on the plant residues was studied as the cut
plants of pondweed, horse-tail and the birch leaves
fallen into water were placed separately into the mesh
nets. The experiment was conducted in July, 2006. In
plant residues were lifted from the water and washed in
a dish. Part of the suspension was taken for determining
the taxonomic attribution and quantitative calculations.
The number of the algae was calculated for 1 g of dry
initial mass of the cut macrophytes.
The biomass of the algae was calculated with vol-
ume-counting method [9]. The coefficient of recalcula-
tion of the wet mass of the algae into dry mass is 20%
[10]. The taxonomic attribution of the algae was deter-
mined under the light microscope with 600 and 1500
magnification, using the guides from the series “Guide
to fresh-water algae of the USSR” (in Russian), “Guide
to fresh-water algae of Ukranian SSR” (in Ukranian),
“Fresh-water diatoms and blue-green algae in the water
bodies in Yakutia” [11] and Central Asia [12, 13]. For
determining the ecological characteristics of the algae
we used the data from the works [14–16].
of Lake Teletskoye to a depth
of 1.5 m we revealed 446 species (538 taxa lower than
genus) of algae from 9 sections. The list primarily con-
sists of Bacillariophyta (42% of species composition),
are most diverse (Tables 1, 2). The species of diatoms
utz. in various ratios form the dominating (in cell
densities) complex in all areas of the lake studied at dif-
ferent times. No constantly occurring species of
blue-green and green algae have been revealed except
is found in many open areas of the lake along the water
The biomass shows the tendency to increase as the
depth grows. Thus, an average value of the biomass of
the algae in epilithon in July 1998 at a depth of 0.5 m
was 3.21, and at a depth of 1.5 m—42.6 g/m
crease of the quantitative parameters of the algocenoses
of periphyton and benthos as the distance to the water
edge grows bigger has been noted in other lakes with
developed wave-cut process [17–24]. The character of
the curve of distribution of the quantitative characteris-
tics of the benthos algae over the depth is similar to that
revealed by V. N. Nikulina [25] for periphyton of Lake

Onega. The highest values are observed at the optimal
combination of light intensity and wind-wave load.
Therefore, the location of the curve peak would change
depending on the water body, season, and weather.
In Lake Teletskoye at a depth of less than 1.5 m no
seasonal and year-to-year dynamics of the phyto-
epilithon structure has been noted. It is likely to be con-
nected to the prevailing influence of hydrodynamic
factor over the algocenoses that creates unstable condi-
tions, under which small-celled pioneering and wide-
spread species of algae primarily vegetate or the algae
resistant to the dynamic load of water, such as
. Since the instability in the shallow areas of the
littoral is observed all year around, the structure of the
algocenoses is similar for the whole period of algae
As the water level in the lake drops, the algocenoses
with large biomass come under the wave influence. The
flakes of diatoms are torn from the substrate by the
waves and transported to pelagic zone or along the
shores making the impression of the bloom.
At a depth of 1.5–30 m some filaments or stands of
The increase of unfavorable environmental factors
directed toward the water edge is indicated by the re-
place of polydominant communities with monodomi-
nant ones. Thus, at a depth from 2–3 to 30 m the
dominant. Poretskii and Sheshukova [8] give 6 to 12
dominating species. At a depth of less than 1.5 m only
In phytoepilithon the cosmopolite forms dominate,
199 taxa lower than genus (37% of the total composi-
tion). The Arctic-Alpine forms make up 28 (5.2%),
boreal—96 taxa (17.8% of the total composition). The
range of salinity reflects the low mineralization of the
water in the lake. The share of indifferent species is
Mesohalophiles count 9 taxa (1.7%). The indicators of
pH are prevailed by indifferent species—100 taxa
(18.6% of the total composition). The excess of the
share of alkaliphiles (81 and 15.1%) over the acido-
philes (14 and 2.6%) is a reflection of alkalescent me-
dium reaction. The characteristic in relation to the
organic pollution is known only for 35.3% of all listed
algae forms. The majority of them, 146 taxa (27.1%),
water plants in Lake Teletskoye lists 182 species of al-
gae (203 taxa lower than genus) of six sections. The list
is dominated by diatoms (53% of the species composi-
The highest diversity is shown by the families Fra-
The similarity of phytoepiphyton on different spe-
cies of macrophytes varies from 8 to 64%. The highest
number of species (54) is noted on
species dependence of algae and macrophytes have
been revealed, like in other water bodies [26, 27]. The
changes in the structure of phytoepiphyton are related
to the decrease in the wave load as moving away from
the beds bordering the open water towards the beds near
the shores, regardless of the vegetation type. Towards
the shore the species diversity of the algae increase in
general including the blue-green algae of the genera
versity of the unicellular blue-green algae of the genera
tendency is revealed for the biomass of phytoepiphyton
to increase towards the shore. Within the dominating
complex on various species of macrophytes the diatoms
The biomass of the algae of epiphyton changes from
and corresponds to the values of the mass of
phytoepiphyton in other oligotrophic water bodies and
In addition to the algae, large amount of mineral and
organic particles and sand deposit on the macrophytes
forming epiphytic suspension (the term is introduced
by E. P. Yanin [33]). The ratio of the mass of the
epiphytic suspension and the mass of the macrophyte
varies from 0.47 to 25.07, increasing on the macro-
phytes with more dissected surface. The change in the
mass of epiphytic suspension on the macrophytes with
homogeneous surface (flat or dissected leaves) in dif-
ferent areas of the lake leads to conclusion that if the
main stream of the suspended particles comes from the
shore, the mass of the epiphytic suspension is the high-
est near the shore. If more suspended particles come
from the open part of the lake, the mass of the epiphytic
suspension is more in the stands bordering the open wa-
ter. The share of live cells in the epiphytic suspension
on the macrophytes subjected to the wave load is lower
than that in the calmer parts (2 and 30–90%, respec-
Among the algae of the epiphyton the cosmopolite
forms prevail—37.4% of the taxonomic composition
(76 taxa). The Arctic-Alpine forms make up 4.4% (9),
boreal, 14.3% of the total composition (29 taxa). The
range of salinity, like in case of phytoepilithon, reflects
the low mineralization of the water in Lake Teletskoye.

combination of light intensity and wind-wave load.

The share of halophobes is 5.9% (12 taxa) (see Fig. 2).
The share of drimophiles is 2.0% (4 taxa), mesohalo-
philes—1.0% (2 taxa). Among the pH indicators those
of alkalescent reaction of the medium prevail with the
share of alkaliphiles and alkalibionts (21.2% of the total
composition, or 43 taxa) exceeding the share of acido-
philes (3.9%, or 8 taxa). The characteristic in relation to
the organic pollution is known only for 36.0% of all
listed algae forms (73). The majority of them, 30.0%
(61 taxa), are the inhabitants of pure water xeno-,

cantly lower as compared with the live plants, 74 spe-
cies (78 taxa lower than genus) of four sections. It
might be so that the lesser species diversity of the algae
on the decaying plants is related to the lesser amount of
the samples. The diatoms make up 77% of the species
composition, green and blue-green algae, 11% each

The species diversity of the algae on the
cantly lower as compared with the live plants, 74 spe-
cies (78 taxa lower than genus) of four sections. It
might be so that the lesser species diversity of the algae
on the decaying plants is related to the lesser amount of
the samples. The diatoms make up 77% of the species
composition, green and blue-green algae, 11% each
(see Fig. 1). The leaves residues was found to host
35 species of algae, the horse-tail—48, the residues of
the pondweed—39 species. From July to October, as
the substrate decays, the number of the species tends to
grow: from 17 to 41 on the horse-tail and from 24 to 29
on the pondweed. The number of the species on the
leaves residues did not change, remaining 26–27.
As the plants decay, the dominating complex is re-
placed. Thus, the species dominating in their cell densi-
in 1.5 months after the macrophyte’s death by
utz. The change of dominating species during
the decay of the pondweed was as follows:

CONTEMPORARY PROBLEMS OF ECOLOGY Vol. 4 No. 1 2011
The highest species diversity of the algae is revealed
in the communities developing on the rock substrate
(446 species). On vegetating macrophytes and their
residues the species diversity is lower, 182 and 74 spe-
cies, respectively. The highest value of biomass of the
. It is noted that the composition and struc-
ture of both phytoepilithon and phytoepiphyton depend
on the degree of hydrodynamic load on the communi-
ties. On the rock substrate the wind-wave impact in-
creases towards the water edge, with the quantitative
parameters decreasing in the same direction. In the ar-
eas with the stands of macrophytes the highest
wind-wave load is brought on the zone bordering the
open water. Accordingly, the species diversity and bio-
mass of the algae of epiphyton increase from the open

The highest species diversity of the algae is revealed
in the communities developing on the rock substrate
(446 species). On vegetating macrophytes and their
residues the species diversity is lower, 182 and 74 spe-
cies, respectively. The highest value of biomass of the
. It is noted that the composition and struc-
ture of both phytoepilithon and phytoepiphyton depend
on the degree of hydrodynamic load on the communi-
ties. On the rock substrate the wind-wave impact in-
creases towards the water edge, with the quantitative
parameters decreasing in the same direction. In the ar-
eas with the stands of macrophytes the highest
wind-wave load is brought on the zone bordering the
open water. Accordingly, the species diversity and bio-
mass of the algae of epiphyton increase from the open
The change in the water level accompanied by pow-
erful wave-cut process creates unstable conditions for
vegetation of the algae on the rock littoral at a depth of
less than 1.5 m. From May to October in the algo-
cenoses of epilithon the small-celled pioneering and
widespread species of algae or the algae resistant to the
dynamic load of water primarily vegetate, that results in
the absence of seasonal and year-to-year dynamics of
the structure in phytoepilithon at this depth.
Regardless of the substrate type (rocks, water plants,
plant waste), time of study, and volume of the studied
material, the ecological range of the algae in periphyton
is identical and reflects the following hydrochemical
